title: Gauss law - infinite sheet - cylinder - point P

content.question: An infinite sheet has a uniform surface charge density <math alttext="sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>σ</mi></math>. The figure shows a cylindrical Gaussian surface that is half above and half below the sheet, with its axis perpendicular to the sheet. Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is located at the center of the top surface of the cylinder, which has area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and is a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> above the sheet. Which of the following equations could be solved to determine the magnitude <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> of the electric field at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>?
